Nijuichidaishu (the twenty one collections of Japanese waka (poetry) compiled by Imperial command)

sen.j: 二十一代集（にじゅういちだいしゅう）とは、天皇が勅命を出し、国家事業として編集された勅撰和歌集である『古今和歌集』から『新続古今和歌集』までの計21集のことである。
sen.e: Nijuichidaishu is a collective term for the 21 anthologies beginning with Kokin Wakashu (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) to Shinshoku Kokin Wakashu (The New Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry Continued) compiled by Imperial command as a state project.

Nijuichidaishu is a collective term for the 21 anthologies compiled by Imperial command as a state project, beginning with Kokin Wakashu (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) and ending with Shinshoku Kokin Wakashu (The New Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry Continued).
sen.cmt: "compiled by Imperial command as a state project." I moved this part towards the beginning of the sentence since it felt like an afterthought at the end
sen.e: Nijuichidaishu is a collective term for the 21 anthologies compiled by Imperial command as a state project, beginning with "Kokin Wakashu" (A Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry) and ending with "Shinshoku Kokin Wakashu" (The New Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry Continued).

sen.j: 「八代集」と「十三代集」とを合わせた歌集の総称を言う。
sen.e: Nijuichidaishu is an incorporation of Hachidaishu (the eight Imperial Anthologies of Japanese poetry) and Jusandaishu (the thirteen Imperial Anthologies of Japanese poetry).
The collection incorporates the Hachidaishu (The Eight Imperial Anthologies of Japanese Poetry) and Jusandaishu (The Thirteen Imperial Anthologies of Japanese Poetry).
sen.cmt: I noticed that "歌集の総称" is translated in the previous sentence, leaving no subject for this sentence, so instead of the title again, I used "collection"
sen.e: The collection incorporates the 'Hachidaishu' (The Eight Imperial Anthologies of Japanese Poetry) and 'Jusandaishu' (The Thirteen Imperial Anthologies of Japanese Poetry).

sen.j: また、古今集以後の三集を「三代集」とも言う。
